title: papundekli22
author: papundekli22
content: https://crypto-exch.com/ what that site guys ? is it legit ? They want deposit for account verification for withdrawing Any suggestion pls ? Best Regards Papundekli22

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: No, it's a scam. no legit exchange will ask you to deposit money before they allow you to withdraw your money.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: papundekli22 on February 02, 2023, 06:37:53 PMhttps://crypto-exch.com/ what that site guys ? is it legit ? They want deposit for account verification for withdrawing Where did you get such a site? It's like someone trying to learn how to create a website, there's no indication that it's an exchange, I thought it was a news site.They claim that they have about 369286.15 BTC (24 hour volume,) although the date of creation of the site did not exceed a few months.QuoteExpires On2023-11-20Registered On2022-11-20Updated On0001-01-01It's a scam, don't fall for such a cheap scam.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: They claimed to have these stats 50000 + Clients crypto-exch which is obviously a fake stat its impossible to have these numbers of clients if you're just a few months this just is another trick to make people believe that they are trusted by people and they are gaining more new clients, if a new exchange showing fake stats it's obviously a scam exchange.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: papundekli22 on February 02, 2023, 06:37:53 PMhttps://crypto-exch.com/ what that site guys ? is it legit ? They want deposit for account verification for withdrawing Any suggestion pls ? I am not familiar with "crypto-exch.com", so I cannot speak to its legitimacy. In general, if a site is asking for a deposit for account verification before you can withdraw your funds, it is a big red flag. And in this case, it is probably a scam. Real exchanges do not operate this way, so proceed with caution.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: If you have an account on the exchange, you agree to the terms written in the User Agreement:Quote3. Crypt-exch AccountCapitalized terms not otherwise defined in these Terms will have the following meaning: Number of Crypt-exch Accounts. Payward may, in its sole discretion, limit the number of Crypt-exch Accounts that you may hold, maintain or acquire. Crypt-exch Account information and security. In order to engage in any trades via the Services, you must create a Crypt-exch Account and provide any requested information. When you create a Crypt-exch Account, you agree to: (a) create a strong password that you do not use for any other website or online service; (b) provide accurate and truthful information; (c) to verify account, need to make a deposit; (d) maintain and promptly update your Crypt-exch Account information; (e) maintain the security of your Crypt-exch Account by protecting your password and restricting access to your Crypt-exch Account; (f) promptly notify us if you discover or otherwise suspect any security breaches related to your Crypt-exch Account; and (g) Users with balance more then 0.3 BTC must activate premium status. (h) take responsibility for all activities that occur under your Crypt-exch Account and accept all risks of any authorized or unauthorized access to your Crypt-exch Account, to the maximum extent permitted by law.https://crypto-exch.com/termsYou see that already within the terms: "to verify account, need to make a deposit".This is a really strange and incomprehensible condition, but you agreed to it, so the blame is on you in the first place, why do you register on such suspicious and unreliable exchanges that contain such conditions.There are a lot of popular and reliable exchanges and they have all the features you could want. Why not register there? I do not know what leads you to sign up for such exchanges?

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: This is scam as hell. The picture is clearly guiding a newbie to create a Bitcoin wallet and top up the balance then send to exchange wallet while they are the exchange itself that is source of Bitcoin and other crypto. This is the only exchange I know that has a reverse procedure on how to acquire crypto.
